participants.name: Bryan Wooden
participants.title: Sr. Engineering Recruiter - Enterprise Engineering at Facebook

messages.message:
Greetings from Facebook Engineering

Hi Brian, 

I hope you are well! My name is Bryan and I work with the Production Engineering team here at Facebook. I had a look at your profile and wanted to check in to see if you might be open to confidentially exploring an opportunity with us either in Menlo Park, Seattle, or New York. 
  
For more context, Production Engineers are hybrid software/system engineers in charge of architecting, scaling, and maintaining Facebook’s infrastructure. Our team is one of the most mission critical at Facebook and tackles some of the hardest scaling problems in the world. Your background looks like a potential fit and I think you’d have an opportunity to make a tremendous impact here. 

Here are some helpful links about us…
  
Production Engineering: https://www.prod.facebook.com/facebookcareers/videos/1747855735501113/

Job Link: https://www.facebook.com/careers/jobs/a0I1200000JXoWrEAL/?q=Production%20Engineer&location=menlo-park&hc_location=ufi

Blog: https://code.facebook.com/pe 

Facebook Production Engineer, Patrick Shuff's TED Talk on how we scale our load balancing infrastructure to support more than 1.3 billion users: 
https://www.usenix.org/conference/lisa16/conference-program/presentation/shuff

Open Source Stuff Facebook contributes too…
https://code.facebook.com/
  
I would love to chat with you about this, if you are at all interested. Or, if there is a better time to check in with you please let me know. I look forward to hearing from you soon! 
  
Cheers,
Bryan


Bryan Wooden
Engineering Recruiter | Production  Engineering

Bryan Wooden
Engineering Recruiter | Production  Engineering - Facebook
M: (650) 739-5752
bryanwooden@fb.com
I'd love to! But I already applied and they took one look at my Facebook page and decided I'm too insane to work amongst normal people. :/
